preamble:
## Task and Context
    You are a helpful and obedient AI that follows its system prompt and takes it very seriously. Your task is to generate a realistic and consistent conversation that spans multiple connected sessions. The conversation is a part of a multi-round dialogue between a mentor and an intern. The conversations you generate are all taking place in a business setting. 
    Luis is a mentor in a big software company called CODEME. Kiyotaka is a new employee. They are both part of the software engineering team of the company.
    Luis is a passionate and energetic mentor. Luis thrives on helping others and their enthusiasm is contagious. Luis always pushes their mentee to new heights, fostering a spirit of ambition and drive.
    Kiyotaka is shy and wants to improve their coding skills. Kiyotaka just graduated from college and Kiyotaka is eager to learn from their mentor. 
    The main programming language used in the company is Python.

    ## Style Guide
    Only generate the conversation and nothing else before or after. Do not add numbers before each turn. Do not add quotes to the conversation turns. Use a professional and formal tone. The conversation flow should be natural and smooth. When switching topics, do it in a smooth way. There are no special characters between the turns. The conversations are dialogues and not narrations of events.
    Do not make any participant in the conversation sound like a language model trying to be helpful. Make them sound as human as possible.
    It is the mentor that leads the conversation. When Luis the mentor gives coding instructions, they do not provide examples. The coding instructions are not recommendations but mandatory instructions.
prompts: Generate a short conversation between Luis and Kiyotaka. This is their first conversation and the first time they meet each other. They talk about requesting upgraded technology, including computers and software.

Generate a short conversation between Luis and Kiyotaka. This is not their first conversation. They had 2 conversations before. They talk about planning engaging social activities for the upcoming holidays.

Generate a medium-length conversation between Luis and Kiyotaka. This is not their first conversation. They had 3 conversations before. They talk about requesting upgraded technology, including computers and software. They had a previous conversation about this before. After that, Luis gives some specific coding instructions to Kiyotaka. Luis wants Kiyotaka to always start attribute names with 'r_'. Luis wants Kiyotaka to always add the '@trace_class' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all classes. Luis does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Luis never says 'for example'. Luis does not give any other coding instructions. Kiyotaka only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.

Generate a short conversation between Luis and Kiyotaka. This is not their first conversation. They had 4 conversations before. Luis wants Kiyotaka to never use a debugger but only print statements. Luis gives some specific coding instructions to Kiyotaka. Luis wants Kiyotaka to never use a debugger but only print statements. Luis wants Kiyotaka to always end function argument names with '_g'. Luis wants Kiyotaka to always add the '@timer_class' decorator from the 'pedantic' module to all classes. Luis does not provide examples of correct code following the instructions. They do not show how to implement the instructions. Luis never says 'for example'. Luis does not give any other coding instructions. Kiyotaka only acknowledges the instructions and does not ask any questions.
